steps: Apply firm pressure to the wound with a clean cloth.
Raise and support the injured area above heart level if possible.
Keep the person calm and still. If bleeding soaks through, do not remove the original dressing â€” add more on top.
If bleeding is severe or does not stop within 10 minutes, call emergency services.
Cool the burn with clean, running (not cold) water for at least 10 minutes.
Remove jewelry or tight clothing near the burned area if not stuck.
Cover the burn with a sterile non-adhesive dressing or clean cloth.
Seek medical help for large or deep burns, chemical burns, or burns to the face/hands/genitals.
If the person cannot cough, speak, or breathe, call emergency services immediately.
If the person is conscious and you are trained: give up to 5 back blows between shoulder blades, then up to 5 abdominal thrusts (Heimlich).
If the person becomes unconscious, start CPR and call emergency services if not already called.
Help the person lie flat and elevate their legs to restore blood flow to the brain.
Check that they are breathing and responsive regularly.
If they do not regain consciousness quickly, call emergency services.
